title: Time labels in minutes or hours?

repository.name: tudo
repository.description: :white_check_mark: A single version of the truth with integrated task tracking, delegation and accountability.

body:
Should "time-estimate" and "time-actual" labels display in the UI as hours or minutes?

As in: "time-estimate:300" vs. "time-estimate:5hrs".

What is more intuitive? And what is more effective for team management?

@NataliaLKB suggested A/B testing this later down the line.

comment_items.body:
Personally I think we should display in the UI as 5 hrs as a first iteration. 
For me that seems more intuitive.

Most people intuitively understand minutes up to a number depending on their reference point.
e.g: 
+ People who watch/play sports will think in terms of **90mins**
+ People who  watch lots of movies will be comfortable with **126mins**

My suggestion would be: everything over `{X}m` minutes should be displayed as `{H}h` (_preferably **rounded down** to the nearest hour_)

But, we need to figure out how to A/B test this... and ask for feedback from people *using* **Tudo**.

title: Create HTML structure for files

repository.name: tudo
repository.description: :white_check_mark: A single version of the truth with integrated task tracking, delegation and accountability.

body: We need to put together some HTML structure for the server-side team rendering to know what they are rendering!

comment_items.body:
We needed to have an issue to work against whilst @msmichellegar and I put together our proposed HTML structure. The _proposal_ is what this issue is here for and we were open to suggestions, hence the 'help wanted' label.
These needed to be put together as quickly as possible so that we weren't a bottleneck for the server-side rendering tasks, such as #45.

This is now done in its most basic form for the MVP and added as PR #55 .

title: Mysteriously disappearing bottom border in mobile view

repository.name: tudo
repository.description: :white_check_mark: A single version of the truth with integrated task tracking, delegation and accountability.

body:
CSS does crazy things. We have a weird issue where our bottom borders disappears in the Chrome mobile view. This is not a problem when we open it without the mobile view, or in any other browsers.

Must investigate this behaviour to figure out if it's a real mobile view issue, or just a Chrome dev tools issue.

Desktop view:
![bottom-border-appears-in-desktop-view](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4185328/8847155/0a7b4440-3124-11e5-8ec2-35d1a8fae132.png)

Mobile view in Chrome:
![bottom-border-disappears-in-mobile-view](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4185328/8847156/0a9d2092-3124-11e5-9c6d-65e652f3a6c6.png)

comment_items.body: @msmichellegar is this _reproducible_ on the *actual* device or is it specific to the Chrome emulator?
@nelsonic We are yet to test this. Just leaving this issue here so we know to come back and figure that out.

title: DWYL Tudo Badge

repository.name: tudo
repository.description: :white_check_mark: A single version of the truth with integrated task tracking, delegation and accountability.

body: Create a nice svg badge and suitable link for readmes.

comment_items.body:
@jrans love this idea! what copy would go in the badge/button? max 3 words (_preferably two_)

Examples: https://github.com/dwyl/repo-badges

David has the most words: [![Dependency Status](https://david-dm.org/dwyl/tudo.svg)](https://david-dm.org/dwyl/tudo)
Gitter has *branding* (_and **tracking**_) in their badge: [![Join the chat at https://gitter.im/{ORG-or-USERNAME}/{REPO-NAME}](https://badges.gitter.im/Join%20Chat.svg)](https://gitter.im/docdis/?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=badge)

I quite like the idea of having a number (_preferably a percentage_) which shows how far the project (repo) is from being "done". 
e.g: [![Tudo Prioritises GitHub Issues](https://img.shields.io/badge/tudo-37%-brightgreen.svg?style=flat)](https://github.com/dwyl/tudo/issues)

But I'm _sure_ others will have _great ideas_ for what to put in the Repo Badge. 
What were you thinking when you raised this issue...?

title: Pre-fetch people's issues while they are authenticating with GiHub

repository.name: tudo
repository.description: :white_check_mark: A single version of the truth with integrated task tracking, delegation and accountability.

body:
instead of waiting for people to perform the steps to authorise Tudo (to access their GitHub orgs/issues we *could* request their GitHub username on the login page and initiate the retrieval of their issues *while* they are authenticating... That way, by the time they get back to Tudo their issues dashboard is already pre-rendered and loaded! This is a ***wow-factor*** people won't be *expecting* and thus our app immediately delivers on our first promise!

Thoughts?

comment_items.body: I'd love to test this out, if the performance works like you expect, that would be super cool!

@iteles have you watched the **Foundation** Episode featuring ***Kevin Systrom*** (***instagram***) ?
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nld8B9l1aRE

What were the [**USP**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unique_selling_proposition)s that contributed to ***instagram***'s success (_considering how many photo-related-apps were in the app store at the time_) ?

cc: @besarthoxhaj

title: unestimated time label -  functionality

repository.name: tudo

body:
When created an issue unestimated label automatically given by backend?

When estimated time added need time unestimated removed by backend.

comment_items.body:
This is *functionality* we need to *build*. 

> As an organisation/repo owner using **Tudo** to Organise & Prioritise GitHub Issues I would like the _option_ of automatically assigning a Lable of "**Time-Unestimated**" to all new issues/stories which have not yet been estimated. 

> Once an issue has been estimated the "**Time-Unestimated**" label should *automagically* be removed from the issue.

@iteles how does that sound?

title: Custom Milestones

repository.name: tudo
repository.description: :white_check_mark: A single version of the truth with integrated task tracking, delegation and accountability.

body: Just like custom labels #34 need to discuss whether we'd like to create milestone templates and how they can link to labels.

comment_items.body:
@jrans are you preparing the research on **Custom Milestones** to present to people?
e.g. create a custom-milestones.md file where you describe _in detail_:
+ what problem are you trying to solve
+ how do custom milestones (_attempt to_) solve that problem
+ why should people start using custom milestones for their projects/repos ?

This is not an "***MVP*** *feature*", but I *agree* it would be *super useful* so please describe it!

title: discuss components

repository.name: tudo
repository.description: :white_check_mark: A single version of the truth with integrated task tracking, delegation and accountability.

body:
- [ ] What are our basic components ?
- [ ] Should we document how we plan on sharing reusable modules on separate modules.

comment_items.body:
Good question @benjaminlees ! 
Not really something I'm going to have the answers for. 
Looks like we need the #discussion label for our org...

Given the discussion this morning focussed on the components required to render the **Homescreen** and **Issues _Views_**: These can be broken down into: ## Homepage + **Layout** (all the html boiler plate for meta tags and css) + **Navigation** (blue) + (_Assigned to_) **Me** ("card") + **Issues partial** (used to iterate through the list of issues and render rows) featuring + Issue title + org/repo name + first line of the issue body (truncated to fit in mobile client) ## Issue view + **Navigation** showing issue number and the organisation / repository it relates to Issue: + **Issue Title** + **Opened by** (github username) + **DateTime** (when the issue was opened) + **Labels + Colors** + **Issue Body** (_First Comment_ which describes the issue) **Switch** (show all comments vs. show latest comment) **Latest Comment** + Avatar (profile picture) + GitHub Username + Comment @dwyl/doers am I missing anything?
